info.name: Wildewood Native
info.description: The Wildewood Native Background from The (Incomplete) Annals of Aldebräis
info.author: Thomas Beazer

p.em: "The roots of the Wildewood run deep, deeper than any mountain, any cave or tunnel. It speaks to those who are willing to listen, to those who are willing to learn, to understand. To know the Wildewood is to know the world in all its wild glory."

description.p: To most, the Wildewood is an impassable barrier - a wild, inscrutable force of nature. To a lucky few, it is part of them and their lives, whether they are foresters, alchemists, or simply recluses. You are one of these lucky few, having grown up in and around the Wildewood and learnt to coexist with it, perhaps even tame it a little. While common folk may regard with you with suspicion, or even fear, the things you've learnt and the experiences you've had are more than worth it in your eyes.

ul.li: Tool Proficiencies: Herbalism Kit, Cook's Utensils
Equipment: A herbalism kit, cook's utensils, a set of traveller's clothes, a trophy or trinket you found or made in the Wildewood and a belt pouch containing 10 sp

description.p: The Wildewood is in your blood, and calls to you in a way you can't easily explain. Its influence might be subtle, or perhaps not so much. Think about who you are, and what you've done with your time. You can roll on the following table to determine how you've interacted with the Wildewood, or choose one that best fits your character.

Those who spend extended periods of time in or around the Wildewood are often thought of as wild and uncouth, but this isn't always the case. You likely have strong connections to your birthplace and the community you were or are a part of, if any. You're also probably 'wild' in some way or another - overly curious about everything, brazen and nearly fearless, reserved and vigilant or otherwise anamalistic.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I don't sleep well in proper beds. I'd much rather be out watching the stars.
I long to visit every land or place I can, and will take any opportunity to travel somewhere new.
I don't understand manners or civility. They just get in the way.
I learn with my hands, and am generally a very hands-on, physical person.
I know how to deal with every creature in the Wildewood, from titanic owlbears to diminuitive fey.
I find it much easier to befriend animals than people.
My memories and experiences are worth so much more than gold and trinkets could ever be.
I live in the moment - yesterday is history, and tomorrow is uncertain, so why worry about them?

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Growth: Nothing, and no-one, is permanent or fixed. (Chaotic)
Wilderness: The wild endures, and we endure with it. (Neutral)
Respect: People, creatures and the land that cradles them are sacred. (Good)
Learning: The answers are always there, if we can but find them. (Any)
Harmony: We are all a part of a greater whole, as is all we know. (Good)
Beauty: Everything can be made beautiful and wonderous. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: The wild isn't cruel, it is fair. We should strive to be more like it.
Those who despoil the wild need to be taught a lesson; ideally a harsh one.
My people will live on, whether through their legend or my blood.
Nothing worth doing was ever easy, and it never will be.
In my dreams, I see visions of a world stripped of the wild, bound and dying. I will not let this come to pass.
A fey creature taught me many things, and now I owe them a debt.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I am quick to get defensive, and often violent.
People scare me, and I tend to avoid interacting with them.
Every risk is worth taking if you know what you're doing.
I enjoy life's treats a tad too much...
I'm terrible with money, and often end up in debt.
I'm quite blunt and often offend people without meaning to.

description.p: You have spent the better part of your life interacting with the Wildewood, and have learnt much from it. You cannot become lost except by magical means, even in the Wildewood. In addition, you can find edible food and water for yourself and up to five others while within the Wildewood, and have a basic idea of how to deal with most of the threats found within.
